intro: Hieracium hypogymnum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring a hairy stem and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish at the base. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium hypogymnum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
